column1: Data Export Generated on Mon Jul 05 20:07:37 PDT 2021

column19: Hi there! Thank you very much for your time.We really appreciate it. Please please help us understand corporate behavior answering this short survey. We'd love to pay you for completing this task and will surely do it as long as you answer to the best of your knowledge. We know you will answer in this fashion as you are too cool to answer in a rush or not paying attention to the questions ;)
column20: Consent Form1.      What is the study about?You are invited to participate in a study of consumer behavior. We hope to learn how companies are perceivedby consumers after they engage in certain kinds of corporate behavior. Our intention is to understand someof the factors that influence these perceptions. To gain insights on these perceptions multiple-choice questionswill be asked about certain aspects of the behavior of the companies.Answers will then be analyzed to gain insights on how consumers perceive the companies.2.       Do I have to participate?Being part of this study is voluntary. If you want to be part of the study we ask that you read the information below carefully.You can read the information below and decide at the end if you do not want to participate.  3.       Who is being asked to participate?You have been asked to participate because:·         You are part of a society where contact with organizations is frequent. 4.       What will I be asked to do?If you want to take part in this study we will ask you to read a short vignette (or a set of them) and answer a short questionnaireregarding it (them). It will take around 10 minutes of your time to be part of this study. You will receive a compensation of 0.4 after completing the survey in its totality.5.       What are the benefits?The benefit of you taking part in this study is that you will contribute to research on consumer behavior. The expected benefits to society in general are a better understanding of how consumers think about organizations. 6.       What are the risks?With any study there are (1) risks we know about (2) risks we don’t know about and (3) risks we don’t expect.If you experience something that you aren’t sure about please contact us immediately so we can discuss the best way to manage your concerns.           Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co       We have listed the risks we know about below. This will help you decide if you want to be part of the study.·         You can experience some distress upon reading the description of the scenario(s).7.       What will happen to information about me?By clicking on the ‘I agree start questionnaire’ button this tells us you want to take part in the study.We will collect information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are.We will store information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are. We will publish information about you in ways that will not be identified in any type of publication from this study.We will keep your information indefinitely after the project is completed and might use it for future related projects.The data will be available publicly so that other researchers can replicate the findings.  Notice that no personal information that can identify you will be collected in this study. The personal information you provide will be handled in accordance with applicable privacy laws any health information collected will be handled in accordance with the Health Records Act 2001 (Vic). Subject to any exceptions in relevant laws you have the right to access and correct your personal information by contacting the research team.8.       Will I hear about the results of the study?We will let you know about the results of the study by email upon request to the principal investigator. Please consider that it can take several months before this research is published.9.       What if I change my mind?If you no longer want to complete the questionnaire simply close the web browser.If you change your mind after clicking on the ‘Submit’ button we cannot withdraw your responses because we cannot link who you are with your questionnaire responses. 10.    Who can I contact for questions or want more information?If you would like to speak to us please use the contact details below:Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co  Consent Form –Declaration by ParticipantI (the participant) have read understood the Participant Information Statement and any questions have been answered to my satisfaction. I agree to participate in the study I know I cannot withdraw my responses following the collection of my data but that I can abandon the survey at any point during the completion of it. I agree information provided by me or with my permission during the project may be included in a thesis presentation and published in journals on the condition that I cannot be identified. I also understand that my responses to the questionnaire will be part of a data set that will be publicly available and that the dataset can be used for any future studies.If you wish to receive a copy of the study results you can request it by contacting Mr Luis Alfredo Arango at laarangoso@unal.edu.co. The results are expected to be available around November 2022. This long period is due to the duration of academic journals’ peer-review processes.
column24: What is your highest degree or level of school you have completed?
column27: Please read carefully the following scenario as ALL the questions make reference to it: Crimson House Inc is a gigantic local construction company with thousands of employees all over the country. Crimson builds residential properties. The massive company has been operating for over ten years in your country and its financial situation is excellent with billion-dollar profits. One day Crimson’s board decides to increase the company’s profits by employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson and they decide to stick with it. However thousands of house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column31: What do you think about the behavior of Crimson?
column32: You will be presented with some statements. Please choose your level of agreement with the statements using the options given.
column33: Here is a reminder of the scenario in case you need it. Please take into account that all the questions will make reference to it:  Crimson House Inc is a gigantic local construction company with thousands of employees all over the country. Crimson builds residential properties. The massive company has been operating for over ten years in your country and its financial situation is excellent with billion-dollar profits. One day Crimson’s board decides to increase the company’s profits by employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson and they decide to stick with it. However thousands of house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column72: Please write a random six digit number (don't be predictable for example 123456" as this would be used to pay you). Please place the same code on Mturk when prompted."

column31: terribly unethical but pretty normal scummy behavior from big business so i am not surprised

I think it is wrong, they are already making millions and should not make lesser quality housing out of greed for more money.  Furthermore, the fact that they are using the cheaper materials only in lower income neighborhoods is unethical.
I think the practice of using cheap materials to maximize profit is all too common today.  I think Crimson is typical of a lot of companies.
not good at all. Shows they dont care about their customres.
I think its unethical and immoral. I think its horrible. I think that people may be hurt by this and certainly will be living in inferior housing due to the cheap materials.

I think the behavior of Crimson is shameful, but not surprising. This is just par for the course with so many construction companies, and even those that dont try to shave off safety for profit; probably dont go farther than the minimum. Its business as usual.
Obviously what they choose to do, using cheap materials in low income neighborhoods, is immoral.  Its putting profits ahead of people. They need to be put out of business.
I dislike it. Theyre taking advantage of low-income families by using cheaper materials on the homes those families live in.
I think they do horrible things and are not very ethical.
They have made more money by cutting corners, but this could cost them in the long run.
Its behavior is shady but unsurprising.
They are trying to cut corners, which in result will cause problems with the houses they build in the future. They are going to get into a lot of trouble for using cheap materials.

I think it is morally wrong to do this to people that are already struggling and now they will have to struggle to pay for repairs that could have been avoided if Crimson were to build their homes the same as the wealthier people.
I think their use of cheaper materials for low-income residential buildings is careless and immoral.
This is big company who is using cheap materials for construction and not reliable.
I feel like they are really cheap. I feel like if they really cared about their people, then they would not use any cheap materials.
unethical and discriminating in its application of what was done.
abhorrent
It is appropriate
The behavior is not acceptable and is not ethical / sustainable.
IT IS IMMORAL
They became greedy. You used cheaper materials, you should not be surprised by the negative impact it may have as a result.
Such behavior is unethical as it puts their consumers at risk
I think it is immoral but probably not uncommon among construction companies.
Aggressive and expansive.

It is dishonest behavior and it is bad for the environment. They are taking advantage of their customers. The building materials that they use should be have to be disclosed to homebuyers and should be regulated by the government.

Their behavior is terrible.  The reason, I believe, they decided to use lower quality materials in a low income neighborhood is because those who are low income may not attribute the building problems to Crimson House.  I think they should be fined heavily.

The behavior of Crimson House Inc is totally unacceptable and needs to be brought to justice by evaluating the materials used in the constructions of the building and be appropriately sentence in the court.
It is not ethical.
I think it is very unethical to build low income houses with cheaper materials. The people who will live in these houses wont be able to afford to pay to keep up with all of the maintenance needed.

I think its despicable to willingly use inferior materials. First of aLl because theyre taking advantage of low income citizens. And also because they already make a hug profit. Why do they need to harm peoples living situations to gain a little more?

I think the behavior of Crimson is greedy, dangerous and unjust because they are putting peoples lives in danger, by using cheap building materials in low income housing. They are doing this for more money, thus they are putting many innocent people at risk.
It can be understood why they might switch to cheaper materials given the current prices, but it is unethical and wrong.
Starts as a good, honest business, but becomes greedy with growth
very wrong
I think that its awful. Not only do they need to pay more in the long run, but tenants and homeowners can get seriously hurt if their residents collapse of otherwise break.
Its all too common as businesses seek ways to make more profits, they forget what got them to where they were and in the end they damage themselves and their customers more than any benefits
I think it is unethical
It is unethical.

Crimson seems like a company that is doing what companies are meant to do, which is to make profit. Although if I were to potentially buy a house and come across Crimson I would probably do research on the company and be turned off by it. So in the long run this behavior, is probably not in the best interest for profit.
I dont like it at all.  It is a shady and misleading way of doing business.  They are basically lying to their customers for financial gain and it is unacceptable.
I feel like that exact situation is one most big corporations find themselves in, 9/10 times. In a nutshell, cut corners at consumer expense to increase profits.
The behavior of this company is not acceptable and is not ethical. They benefit by harming their customers.
I think it was inappropriate and unethical. Crimson put money over people in their business. They did not care about the repercussions of their actions as long as they were making money.
I think Crimsons actions were immoral and unjustifiable.
I think its very unethical to use cheaper materials to gain profit.
I think that it is wrong for them to use cheap materials in low income areas knowing it will lead people to have to pay for pricey repairs.
Not very consider and money hungry.
I think the behavior of Crimson is completely wrong and unethical.
I think it is bad behavior even if not illegal. I hope developers would go with better builders in the future. If the company lied about the materials they used, they should be sued.
I think it’s shady and wrong to take advantage of people and focus on profits.
Its disgusting

It seems like they just want to increase profits. I have no idea why a company that is capable of building quality housing would resort to making inferior products. They could easily make superior products and sell them at higher prices. It depends on how good their marketing team is.

Another company out to make as much money as possible and doing it the wrong way . I feel they should be shut down and made to rebuild all the properties over using the same materials they used before cutting corners and using cheap material .
I think they are blinded of the fact that in order to increase their profits, they should employing cheaper materials to construction houses.
Its very unethical!
They are trying to cut costs without thinking about how that trickles down to the consumer.
it totally wrong and unacceptable. All clients regardless of their

I think the company is being greedy and its not right that people have to pay more in the long run because the company is using cheaper materials to build their homes. Its not honest. Its not right either.
Bad

It is deplorable! Its also not surprising as this is how capitalism works and is perpetuated. Humans are naturally self serving and greed is rampant when profits are involved. Its very disheartening and I would likely be a whistleblower if this was my company.
It is just morally wrong. Will be hurting people in the long term.
I think it is negligent as inferior products can put people in harm.
I believe it is unethical and there must be laws to limit this type of immoral activities.
It is not okay. They should no discriminate based on income. They should not be using cheaper materials.
Appalling and they should be ashamed of themselves and even punished (make them pay for maintenance and/or repairs, building new portions, jail time, etc.).
very unacceptable
I think Crimsons behavior is unethical and repercussions should happen. While it may save the company money it is unfair to treat poor home owners badly by using cheaply made materials.

The behavior of Crimson Inc. is unethical and immoral since its decision to increase the companys profits by building houses in sub-urban areas using cheaper material can be disastrous for the people living in the houses. Also, it damaged its own reputation since many customers are shelling out extra money from their pockets to repair and renovate their new homes only because they were damaged by the use of cheaper low-quality materials.
reprehensible
I think using cheap materials in an area where it will go relatively unnoticed is ethically wrong.
I think Crimson Inc has behaved in a very bad and irresponsible way
Not ethical.  This practice will come back to bite them in the rear because word will get out that houses were built with low quality, and it will eventually hurt their bottom line.
I think it would be wrong to use the cheaper materials and cause issues for homeowners. I think they should have used the same materials for everyone.
Its not the most ethical company, but if they want to go down that path of conducting business it will catch up with them.

I think they are putting profits above ethics and also setting themselves up for law suits when the consumers find out about it. I see a class action lawsuit against Crimson for  misrepresenting the materials used in their construction and also targeting lower income people.
I love that they can exploit the poor like they do on mturk

I believe they are a greedy corporation who will take advantage of every situtation they can to increase their profits if they can get away with it. They do not care about people or the communities in which they conduct business.
It’s not ethical. But no one has ever gotten rich being ethical so I’m not surprised
I think the behavior is greedy as they were already raking in a huge profit.

It is unethical and disreputable.  By using cheaper materials and forcing the costs on to low income homeowners, the company is ultimately making profits at the expense of the broader community, if the local or regional governments have to assist these homeowners.  More troubling is the specific decision to take advantage of low-income families that would not notice the use of cheaper materials.  This is misrepresentation for the sake of higher profits.

Its typical, but that doesnt make it right.  They are taking advantage of low income people which makes their behavior particularly bad.  They make a lot of money and just used cheap materials to line their own pockets.
I think its horrible that a profitable company gets greedy and uses cheaper materials to increase their greed!

It is common for large companies to branch out to lower marketes using lower quality materials. As long as the consumer is aware of they are getting what they are paying for then it is acceptable practice.
It is unethical to use lower quality materials in low income neighborhoods, where the homeowners likely cannot afford expensive home repairs.

I think that this company is very immoral and unethical in its business practice. They decided to focus on profits rather than customer satisfaction and did not care that they were costing their clients money for poor material use.
I do not like the behavior of Crimson. Cutting corners, using cheaper materials for low income areas is immoral and unkind.

I think it is going to be tragic in the long run the way they conduct and do business, this includes the tenants they build residential properties for. I think Crimson is unethical and they cut too many corners, sooner or later karma will come back to bite them. All they seem to care about is profit, when a company loses its humanity they either fall hard or become unsuccessful, I think there are repercussions to what they do and they know what they do which makes it worse. To sum up Crimson is such careless company. They remind me of the condo that collapsed in Florida, so much irresponsibility went into that residence, its very sad and unfortunate. Whats done in the dark is always brought to light, the shadiness of Crimson needs to stop. They need to learn just like everyone else.
Their behavior is immoral and unethical. They put lives at risk by doing what they did and should be prosecuted for it
It was unethical, and they paid the price for it.
It is unethical.
I think they are a little greedy considering what they are doing with using cheap materials to construct houses for low income people. Unfair and immoral.
i think it’s unethical. it would only be  acceptable if the houses are sold at a cheap price.

It seems like theyre only concerned about themselves and their own profitability. Thats not necessarily wrong for their side but it is bad for the consumer side and likely to drive customers away from them.
I think the behavior of Crimson is horrible. They are willing to risk others to increase their bottom line.
It is unscrupulous, unethical, cheating, and lying.

I think it puts them in a bad light.  Its kind of dishonest that they lower their standards when it comes to building low income housing.  Apparently the company doesnt care that using cheaper materials compared to what they would normally use costs people who are already low income money that they dont have for costly repairs that could have been prevented.
they are a bunch of crooks. Taking advantage of poorer people for finacal gain.
immoral and selfish
I think it is understandable to cut costs, but largely immoral to give some people different service quality than others.
I feel they are unethical and concerned about profits only.
I think the behavior of Crimson is terrible. They are putting people at risk by using cheap materials.

I think its typical behavior in corporate United States. Shorting society is the way corporations do business. Its legal and too many people are lining up to be taken advantage of, in the name of capitalism, so I think its behavior that is to be expected, from every successful corporation based in the United States.
I think its reprehensible, as it puts peoples lives at risk in terms of using those cheaper materials. Theyre already so profitable that they shouldnt resort to this.
irresponsible and selfish
I think it is an unfortunate choice and they shouldnt be being so cheap and taking advantage. Sad.
understand why however they should be ashamed of doint it
I think it is dishonest and I disagree with it.  Building cheaper, especially without letting anyone know, is dishonest.  These people are already low income so they probably cant afford the repairs.
Its reprehensible, but not surprising.  In society, those with the least voice are the ones most often taken advantage of.
BAD
I find the behavior of Crimson deceiving and definitely unfair. I think it is inappropriate to use cheap materials in low incoming housing projects.

I think it was very greedy and ignorant of them. They put peoples lives and their livelihoods at stake just to make a quick buck as if a gigantic company isnt already raking in millions and over charging.
Using cheap materials is unethical. I think its a bad business practice.
I think they are greedy and ripping off people.
Its deplorable and they should face sanctions for it.
I think Crimson became an unethical company that is going to cause a lot of bad things to happen to good people
Evil
Shameful.
It is reprehensible, but it is not surprising. Big corporations make these types of decisions all the time.
I think it is unethical what they did. They cut corners to increase their own profits but hurt the customers who had to burden the extra cost.

I think it is pretty standard.  My ultimate opinion would depend on whether the home was under some kind of warranty and for how long.  It is not a new practice to use cheaper materials for less expensive products.  As long as it passed all local building codes then, you get what you pay for.
I think its disgusting and can actually be a hazard for people who live in the homes. I do not believe they are ethically or morally good.
